p: Pathogens have evolved a range of defense mechanisms to overcome the immune response modifying their infectivity and dissemination in the host ( 44, 45). The complement system, a major arm of the innate immune system, consists of several soluble factors and cell surface receptors that interact with and react to invading pathogens. Some pathogens mimic and recruit complement inhibitors, such as factor H and C4b binding protein (C4BP) to escape complement ( 46â€“ 48).
